sentences.en: "Let me in, Di." — "Okay. Just a minute."
sentences.cn: “让我进来，迪。”——“好的。稍等一下。”

sentences.en: "Wait a damn minute," Mindy spat. "Nobody said anything about staying overnight."
sentences.cn: “该死的，等一下”，明迪愤愤地说道，“谁也没说过要过夜。”

sentences.en: Any minute now, that phone is going to ring.
sentences.cn: 那部电话随时可能响。

sentences.en: Callers are charged a premium rate of 48p a minute.
sentences.cn: 打电话要支付每分钟48便士的附加费。

sentences.en: Calls cost 36p (cheap rate) and 48p (peak rate) per minute.
sentences.cn: 电话每分钟36便士（优惠费率）和48便士（高峰费率）。

sentences.en: Calm down for a minute and listen to me.
sentences.cn: 你安静一会儿，听我说。

sentences.en: don't think for a minute that our pricing has affected our quality standards.
sentences.cn: 千万不要认为我们的定价影响了我们的质量标准。

sentences.en: He got sent off for deliberate handball in the 32nd minute.
sentences.cn: 他在第32分钟时因故意手球犯规被罚下场。

sentences.en: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.cn: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.en: He'd telephoned with some phoney excuse she didn't believe for a minute.
sentences.cn: 他找了某个她根本不会相信的借口给她打电话。

sentences.en: Her handwriting is minute.
sentences.cn: 她的字非常小。

sentences.en: His heart rate was 30 beats per minute slower.
sentences.cn: 他的心率每分钟慢了30次。

sentences.en: His salary was obscene for three 40-minute shows a week.
sentences.cn: 他一周只有3次节目，每次40分钟，但他的薪水实在高得离谱。

sentences.en: I don't believe for one minute she would have been scared.
sentences.cn: 我压根不认为她会有所畏惧。

sentences.en: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.cn: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.en: I've &B{just this minute} got back to the flat.
sentences.cn: 我刚回到公寓。

sentences.en: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.cn: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.en: It will stop in a minute —it's only spitting.
sentences.cn: 雨很快就会停的——这只不过是毛毛雨。

sentences.en: matters grew worse by the minute.
sentences.cn: 事态迅速恶化。

sentences.en: Most people's pulse rate is more than 70 beats per minute.
sentences.cn: 大多数人的脉率都在每分钟70次以上.

sentences.en: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.cn: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

sentences.en: The basic price for a 10-minute call is only £2.49.
sentences.cn: 10分钟的基本通话费只有2.49英镑。

sentences.en: The minute that the war started, everybody was glued to the television.
sentences.cn: 战事一起，所有人都盯紧了电视报道。

sentences.en: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.cn: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.en: wait a minute—I have to put my make-up on.
sentences.cn: 稍等一下——我还要化妆。

sentences.en: wait a minute—that just isn't true.
sentences.cn: 且慢——那根本不对。

sentences.en: You only need a minute amount.
sentences.cn: 你只需要很少的量。

words.tran_cn: [计量][数]分，分钟；片刻，一会儿；备忘录，笔记；会议记录

phrases.tran_cn: （尤指变化进程）迅速地，极快地
n. 完全，彻底；时时刻刻

phrases.phrase: this minute (或 this very minute) informal 非正式

trans.tran_cn: 微小的，详细的 [maɪˈnjuːt; US -ˈnuːt; maɪˋnut]
分（钟），一会儿，时刻，会议记录，备忘录
trans.tran_en: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour
to make an official note of something in the record of a meeting
to make an official note of something in the record of a meeting
